{{Infobox Election | election_name = United States Senate elections, 1866 | country = United States | flag_year = 1865 | type = legislative | ongoing = no | previous_election = United States Senate elections, 1864 | previous_year = 1864 | next_election = United States Senate elections, 1868 | next_year = 1868 | seats_for_election = ? seats in the [[United States Senate]] | election_date = November 1866 | image1 = | party1 = Republican Party (United States) | last_election1 = 39 seats | seats1 = 57 | seat_change1 = +18 | popular_vote1 = | percentage1 = | swing1 = | image2 = | party2 = Democratic Party (United States) | last_election2 = 11 seats | seats2 = 9 | seat_change2 = -2 | popular_vote2 = | percentage2 = | swing2 = | title = Majority Party | before_election = Republican Party | after_election = Republican Party }}
The '''United States Senate election of 1866''' was an election which had the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican Party]] gain eighteen seats in the [[United States Senate]] as several of the Southern States were readmitted during [[Reconstruction era of the United States|Reconstruction]], enlarging their already overwhelming majority.
As this election was prior to ratification of the [[Seventeenth Amendment to the United States Constitution|seventeenth amendment]], Senators were chosen by [[State legislature (United States)|State legislatures]].
==Results== [[40th United States Congress|40th Congress]] (1867â1869)
* Majority Party: Republican (57) * Minority Party: Democratic (9) * Other Parties: (0) * Vacant: (2) * '''Total Seats: 72'''
